notes: The team announced that Vilardi is week-to-week with an upper-body injury.

The Penguins announced on Tuesday (Mar. 11) that Shea is deemed week-to-week.

Klingberg did not play on Saturday (Mar. 22) versus Seattle.

The Detroit Red Wings placed F Carter Mazur on injured reserve on Friday (Mar. 7).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Raphael Lavoie on injured reserve on Saturday (Mar. 8).
The Devils said on Thursday (Mar. 13) that Hamilton will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 regular season, per Mike Morreale of NHL.com.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Jack Hughes on Long-term Injured Reserve on Wednesday (Mar. 5). He's expected to be ready for training camp.
The Panthers said on Tuesday (Mar. 11) that they are hopeful that Marchand should be back before the end of the regular season, per Sr. Digital Content Manager Jameson Olive.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed D Pierre-Olivier Joseph on injured reserve on Monday (Mar. 3).
The Flyers listed Hathaway as OUT for Sunday (Mar. 23) game against Chicago.
The Anaheim Ducks placed F Robby Fabbri on injured reserve on Thursday (Feb. 27).
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Cole Sillinger on injured reserve on Tuesday (Mar. 4).
The Oilers said on Friday (Mar. 21) that Frederic will miss at least another two weeks, according to Tony Brar of Oilers TV.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Joel Eriksson Ek on injured reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 25) and is week-to-week.
The Montreal Canadiens placed F Kirby Dach on the Injured Reserve on Sunday (Mar 2.) and is out for the season.
The Nashville Predators placed D Roman Josi on injured reserve on Saturday (Mar. 1).
Copp will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 campaign after undergoing surgery Tuesday (Feb. 25) to repair a torn pectoral tendon.
The Panthers announced on Monday (Mar. 3) that Tkachuk won't be an option until the postseason, per Florida general manager Bill Zito.
The Blue Jackets announced that Labanc was placed on injured reserve after undergoing shoulder surgery on Friday (Feb. 21) and will miss the rest of the season.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Max Pacioretty on long-term injured reserve on Friday (Mar. 7).
Juulsen had a successful lower-body procedure on Friday (Feb. 28) and is expected to miss approximately 12 weeks, per Canucks' General Manager Patrik Allvin.
The Bruins announced on Saturday (Mar. 15) that McAvoy is still listed as week to week.
Theodore (arm) is with the club on its three-game road trip and is on track to return to the lineup this week, according to Danny Webster of the Las Vegas Review-Journal on Monday.
Contrary to a previous report, Demko will not serve as backup to Kevin Lankinen for Thursday's game versus the Blues. Demko remains on injured reserve, per the NHL media site.
The Nashville Predators placed D Adam Wilsby on injured reserve on Friday (Feb. 21) and will miss the remainder of the season.
The Devils said that Siegenthaler remains on long-term injured reserve and will not play before the end of the regular season, per James Nichols of New Jersey Hockey Now.
The New York Rangers placed F Adam Edstrom on injured reserve on Tuesday (Feb. 4).
The Islanders said on Saturday (Mar. 8) that Barzal remains on long-term injured reserve as he is not guaranteed to be back before the end of the regular season, per Andrew Gross of Newsday.
The Dallas Stars placed D Nils Lundkvist on Long Term Injured Reserve on Saturday (Feb. 1).
The Canadiens announced that Guhle is out indefinitely after undergoing surgery on Wednesday (Jan. 29) to repair a lacerated quadricep muscle.
The Stars said on Tuesday (Mar. 18) that Heiskanen will probably be unavailable for the opening round of the playoffs, per Stars' radio analyst Bruce LeVine.
The Wild said on Friday (Feb. 21) that Kaprizov remains on long-term injured reserve and is slated to be out longer than originally expected as said by Minnesota's GM Bill Guerin, per NHL.com.
The Ottawa Senators placed F Nick Cousins on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Feb. 22).
The Sharks reported on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Rutta is healing slower than anticipated and is not expected to be back soon, per Max Miller of NHL.com.
The Hurricanes said on Friday (Mar. 7) that Carrier is expected to be available to return before the start of the postseason, per Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer.

The Utah Hockey Club reported on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Bortuzzo remains on injured reserve and won't return to the lineup when play resumes after the 4 Nations Face-Off, per Brogan Houston of Deseret News Sports.
The Predators announced on Tuesday (Feb. 18) that Lauzon will miss 4-6 months with a lower-body injury.
The Ducks announced on Tuesday (Jan. 21) that McGinn had surgery to reconstruct his ACL and will be sidelined for 7-9 months.
Regula was never taken off the season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday (Dec. 11), per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.
The Islanders said on Saturday (Mar. 8) that Varlamov remains on long-term injured reserve and is unlikely to return this season, as per Andrew Gross of Newsday.

Stars head coach Peter DeBoer said on Tuesday (Mar. 18) that Seguin is making progress in his recovery and is on track to be back at some point during the regular season or playoffs, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
The Maple Leafs reported on Saturday (Feb. 1) that Hakanpaa won't participate in the upcoming 4 Nations Face-Off.
The Bruins announced on Sunday (Feb. 23) that Lindholm underwent surgery for a fractured patella and is likely out for the season, per Conor Ryan of The Boston Globe.
Capitals' general manager Chris Patrick said on Friday (Mar. 7) that Milano recently sustained a significant setback in his recovery, per Sammi Silber of The Hockey News.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on long-term injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Sharks announced on Friday (Nov. 1) that Couture has not resumed skating and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey.

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The Oilers announced on Friday (Mar. 7) that Kane will miss the remainder of the regular season.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Hurricanes announced on Wednesday (Oct. 9) that Fast is out for the 2024-2025 season as he recovers from neck surgery.
The Blackhawks said on Thursday (Mar. 6) that Brossoit is not expected to play this season, according to Ben Pope of the Chicago Sun-Times.
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Monday (Mar. 3) that Landeskog isn't expected to return before the end of the 2024-25 regular season, per Jesse Montano of Guerilla Sports.
